𒊕𒈪 SAĝ-MEʳ Sumer
𒊕𒈪 saĝ-gíg 'head' + 'black' schwarz

𒅴𒄀;𒅴𒂠 eme-gi;eme-ĝir₁₅ ˢemeĝir Sumerian #šumeritum šumerû
𒅴 𒄀 ˢemengi сма́га smága •zemengir צימאון zimaon szomj ጥም ṭəmᶥⁿᵍ #šurpītu thirst

According to some data, the Sumerians are associated with the Hurrians and Urartians, and the Caucasus is considered their homeland.262728, coming via the Samarra culture.


Near identical building plans of the early Sumerian, Elamite and Egyptian temples, strongly linked iconography and similar ceremonies clearly demonstrate that these are not mere trade-artefacts, but in fact proof of a common anchestry of these higher civilizations.

𒋗𒈨𒊒 Šumeru (Akkadian) Hand of the Maru/Swamp/Reed
𒅴𒄀 Sumerian eme.gi7 Pheme Gir 𓂋𓏤𒂠

𓌢 𓎼 𓂋 𓈉 Egyptian Sngr, Hebrew שִׁנְעָר Šinʿar ע , and Hittite Šanhar(a), all referring to southern Mesopotamia, could be western variants of Sumer.

In sumerian the similar-sounding words "life" [til] and "arrow" [ti] were written with the same symbol 𒋾 ⋍ 𓋹 @ Horus 𓂚

𒅎 Der Thor, der Sturm, der Ton

Most important cities:
Kish northern, semitic since 3000BC(?)
Nippur center of religion
Akkad destroyed by Guti
Ur,Uruk,Eridu south harbors

Lagash&Umma fighting
Susa Elamite partner/adversary

Some 90% of the hundreds of thousands of tablets found in ancient cities such as Nippur and Girsu remain untranslated.

Early Sumerian epics indicate an unusually intimate relationship between Sumer and an otherwise unknown land called Aratta.
